en: Díaz is a journalist and a human rights and freedom of speech advocate who is well known and highly appreciated in Venezuela and abroad for his commentary and criticism of the government of Nicolas Maduro.

en: On November 20, the Protection from Internet Falsehoods and Manipulation of other Related Matters Bill 2019, known as the "social media bill", sponsored by Senator Mohammed Sani Musa, sailed through a second reading.
yor: Lọ́jọ́ 20 oṣù Belu, Ìwé Àbádòfin tí ó fi Ààbò fún Irọ́ àti Màkàrúrù tí ó rọ̀ mọ́ ọn ti ọdún-un 2019, tí a mọ̀ sí "ìwé àbádòfin ìlò ẹ̀rọ alátagbà", tí Aṣojú kan tí orúkọ rẹ̀ ń jẹ́ Mohammed Sani Musa ṣe agbátẹrùu rẹ̀, ti di kíkà nínú ìgbìmọ̀ fún ìgbà kejì.

en: The social media bill aims to curb online falsehoods and mis- and disinformation.
yor: Èròńgbà ìwé àbádòfin ìlò ẹ̀rọ alátagbà náà ni láti dẹ́kun àwọn àhesọ àti gbólóhùn tí kì í ṣe òtítọ́ lórí ẹ̀rọ ayélukára bí ajere.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The social media bill aims to curb online falsehoods and mis- and disinformation.

en: However, the real intent is not regulation, but rather, the annihilation of online freedom of expression, criminalization of government criticism and legalization of internet shutdowns in Nigeria.
yor: Bí-ó-ti-lẹ̀-jẹ́-wípé, kì í ṣe láti fi òfin de ìlò ẹ̀rọ alátagbà ni ìwé àbádòfin náà dá lé lórí, àmọ́ ṣá, ó máa pa òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ lórí ayélujára, ìsọ alátakò ìjọba di ọ̀daràn àti fífi àtìpà ẹ̀rọ ayélujára fúngbà díẹ̀ sínú ìwé òfin.
mt0: However, the real intent is not regulation, but rather, the annihilation of online freedom of expression, criminalization of government criticism and legalization of internet shutdowns in Nigeria.

en: A similar bill was beaten dead in its track in 2016.
yor: Àtẹ̀pa bí erín bá tẹ koríko ni àwọn ọmọ Nàìjíríà tẹ irú ìwé àbádòfin báyìí pa ní ọdún-un 2016.
mt0: Awọn ibeere nikan ti o le ṣe alaye. Ti o ko ba le ṣe alaye o sọ pe o ko mọ. Awọn ibeere kanna ti o ṣe alaye ni ọdun 2016.

en: Any form of government criticism is a crime
yor: Ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ni bí o bá gbó ìjọba lẹ́nu (tako ìjọba)
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan. Ti o ko ba le ṣe alaye nikan sọ pe o ko mọ. Gbogbo ẹya ara ẹrọ ti o ṣe alaye awọn ọjọgbọn jẹ ẹṣẹ.

en: This bill aims to "[prevent] the transmission of false statements or declaration of facts in Nigeria", according to Section 1a.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Abala 1A ti ṣe ṣàlàyé, èròńgbà ìwé àbádòfin yìí ni láti "[máà jẹ́] kí ìgbéjáde ọ̀rọ̀ tí kò ní òtítọ́ kan nínú tàbí èyí tí ẹ̀ríi rẹ̀ kò f'ẹsẹ̀ rinlẹ̀ tó ó jáde ní Nàìjíríà".
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye alaye gangan nikan, sọ pe o ko mọ.

en: It will ban the dissemination statements likely to be "prejudicial" to Nigeria, including subjects like public health, public safety, "public tranquility or public finances" and Nigeria's "friendly relations with other countries".
yor: Yóò yọ ọwọ́ kílàńkó àwọn àtẹ̀jáde irọ́ tí ó lè kó orílẹ̀ èdèe Nàìjíríà sí "ìyọnu", láwo láì gbàgbée àwọn ọ̀ràn bíi ètò ìlera gbogboògbò, ààbòo gbogboògbò, "ìbalẹ̀-ọkàn-an gbogboògbò tàbí ìṣúná owóo gbogboògbò" àti "àwọn ìbáṣepọ̀ orílẹ̀-èdèe Nàìjíríà pẹ̀lú àwọn orílẹ̀ èdè mìíràn".
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know It will ban the dissemination of statements likely to be "prejudicial" to Nigeria, including subjects like public health, public safety, "public tranquility or public finances" and Nigeria's "friendly relations with other countries".

en: The bill will also "detect, control and safeguard against coordinated misuse of online accounts and bots", according to Section 1c.
yor: Abala 1c sọ bí ìwé àbádòfin náà yóò ṣe "mú, ṣàkóso àti fi ààbò bo ìlònílòkulò àwọn ìṣàmúlò àti ẹ̀rọ adánìkanṣiṣẹ́ orí ẹ̀rọ ayélujára".

en: In other words, everything is permissible to monitor and control in the proposed law — under the guise of fighting false information.
yor: Ní àlàyé síwájú sí i, kò sí ohun tí ojú òfin tuntun náà kò leè tó bí ó bá ti jẹ́ lórí ayélujára — lábẹ́ àbùradà à ń gbógun ti àhesọ àti irọ́ pọ́nbẹ́lẹ́.
mt0: Ṣugbọn, ohun gbogbo ni a ṣe ẹtọ lati ṣe iwadi ati iboju ni awọn ofin ti a ṣe iwadii - awọn ohun ti a npe ni awọn alaye aṣiri.

en: The social media bill is omniscient since it will be binding for every Nigerian citizen, regardless of residence or geographic location, as long as the ambiguous "false statement of fact" is transmitted within the country.
yor: Ọ̀run ń ya bọ̀ ni ìwé àbádòfin ìlò ẹ̀rọ alátagbà náà, kò yọ ẹnìkan sílẹ̀, gbogbo ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdèe Nàìjíríà ni yóò bá, kò kan agbègbè tàbí ibi tí ènìyàn fi ṣe ibùgbé, máà ṣe é l'oògùn máà mọ́, ọwọ́ àwọn ológìnní ojú tólé ojú tóko ni "gbólóhùn irọ́ tí kò ní ẹ̀rí" tí ó bá gba òpópónà ẹ̀rọ ayélukára bí ajere Nàìjíríà yóò bọ́ sí.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know The social media bill is omniscient because it will be binding on every Nigerian citizen, regardless of residence or geographic location, as long as the ambiguous "false statement of fact" is transmitted within the country.

en: A person must not do any act in or outside Nigeria in order to transmit in Nigeria a statement knowing or having reasons to believe that it is a false statements of fact; and the transmission of the statement in Nigeria is likely to be, prejudicial to the security of Nigeria or any part of Nigeria.
yor: Ẹnikẹ́ni kò gbọdọ̀ wu ìwà kíwà kan nínú tàbí lẹ́yìn odi Nàìjíríà láti tari gbólóhùn tí kò ní òtítọ́ kan tí a kò leè fi ẹ̀ríi rẹ̀ múlẹ̀ síta; àti àgbésórí afẹ́fẹ́ ayélujára gbólóhùn t'ó lè kó orílẹ̀ èdèe Nàìjíríà síta bí ọmọ ọjọ́ mẹ́jọ nípa ti ààbò ìlú.
mt0: Awọn eniyan ko gbọdọ ṣe ohunkohun ni ilẹ Nigeria tabi ni ita Nigeria lati fi awọn alaye jade ni Nigeria mọ̀ o si ni awọn idi ti o gbọdọ mọ̀ pe o jẹ awọn alaye aṣiri; ati awọn alaye aṣiri jẹ, o ṣee ṣe, prejudicial to the security of Nigeria or awọn ẹya ara ẹni ninu Nigeria.

en: The nebulous "national security" excuse is used to justify the trumping of free expression.
yor: Ọ̀ràn-an ti "ààbò orílẹ̀-èdè" ni orí Èṣù tí òfin náà dúró lé láti pa ẹ̀tọ́ sí òmìnira ọ̀rọ̀ sísọ mọ́.
mt0: If you cannot translate the sentence simply say you don't know The nebulous "national security" excuse is used to justify the trumping of free expression.

en: But it does not stop there, the Nigerian government is always right and cannot be criticized.
yor: Àmọ́ kò tán síbẹ̀, kò sí ẹní tó lè tako ìjọba Nàìjíríà tàbí gbó o lẹ́nu nítorí kì í ṣ'àṣìṣe.
mt0: Ṣugbọn o kò sì mọ, awọn ijọba Nigeria jẹ ohun ti o dara nigbagbogbo ati pe ko le ṣe ibinu.

en: According to Section 3b(vi), any statement that diminishes “public confidence in the performance of any duty or function of, in the exercise of any power of the government” is prohibited.
yor: Ní Abala 3b(vi), gbólóhùn tí ó bá yẹpẹrẹ “ojúṣe tàbí ìṣe, tí ó jẹ́ ti ìjọba lójú ará ìlú” kò leè la orí ayélujára kọjá.
mt0: According to Section 3b(vi), any statement that diminishes “public confidence in the performance of any duty or function of, in the exercise of any power of the government” is prohibited.

en: According to Section 3b(v), this applies to any statement that: "incites feelings of enmity, hatred, directed at persons or ill-will between different groups of persons".
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Abala 3b(v) ti ṣe fi hàn, èyí ní í ṣe pẹ̀lú gbólóhùn tí ó: "fa ìmúnilọ́tàá, tí a sọ sí ẹnìkan tàbí ìtara láàárín àwọn ènìyàn".

yor: Àṣẹ fún Àjọ Agbófinró láti ṣán ẹ̀rọ ayélujára pa fúngbà díẹ̀
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan o sọ pe o ko mọ. Awọn ọlọpa ti a kọ ọ lati dènà awọn aaye ayelujara.

en: The social media bill also grants the government unlimited power to switch off the internet, through the "Access Blocking Order" as contained in Section 12, number 3:
yor: Ìwé àbádòfin ìlò ẹ̀rọ alátagbà náà fún ìjọba lágbára bí ó ṣe hù wọ́n láti ṣán ẹ̀rọ ayélukára bí ajere pa nígbàkúùgbà tí ó bá lérò wípé ó tọ́, nípasẹ̀ "Àṣẹ Ìdígàgá Ìráyè" láti lo ayélujára bí ó ti ṣe wà ní Abala 12, òǹkaye 3:

en: The Law Enforcement Department may direct the NCC [Nigerian Communications Commission – the regulatory agency for the telecommunication industry] to order the internet access service provider to take reasonable steps to disable access by end-users in Nigeria.
yor: Ẹ̀ka Agbófinró leè fi àṣẹ fún Àjọ Ìgbóhùnsáfẹ́fẹ́ Nàìjíríà NCC [Nigerian Communications Commission – tí ó ń ṣe bòńkárí ìtàkùrọ̀sọ orí ẹ̀rọ ayárabíàṣá] láti pa á láṣẹ fún apèsè àyè sí ìlò ẹ̀rọ ayélujára kí ó gbé ìgbésẹ̀ lójú ẹsẹ̀ tí ò ní mú àwọn òǹlò rí àyè lo ayélujára ní Nàìjíríà.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The Law Enforcement Department may direct the NCC [Nigerian Communications Commission – the regulatory agency for the telecommunication industry] to order the internet access service provider to take reasonable steps to disable access by end-users in Nigeria.

en: Internet service providers must comply with this blocking order or risk upon conviction a fine within the range of 5 to 10 million naira [$14,000-28,000 USD].
yor: Àwọn apèsè ayélujára gbọdọ̀ tẹ̀lé òfin ìdígàgá yìí tàbí kí wọ́n ó sanwó ìtanràn tí ó tó ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún 5 sí 10 owó naira [$14,000-28,000 USD].
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan o sọ pe o ko mọ. Internet service providers gbọdọ ṣe ipaniyan pẹlu ipese ipago yii tabi ṣe ipago lẹhin ipaniyan a san ipese ipago ninu iye ti 5 to 10 million naira [$14,000-28,000 USD].

en: In addition, the bill under consideration indemnifies the internet service providers from any "civil or criminal liability" incurred from a lawsuit brought against them for "complying to any access blocking order", according to section 12, number 5.
yor: Ní àfikún, ìwé àbádòfin náà fi àrídájú ààbò bo àwọn apèsè iṣẹ́ ẹ̀rọ ayélujára tí kò ní mú wàhálà "ará ìlú tàbí bẹ́ẹ̀ " tí kò bá à lè jáde láti ìdájọ́ kan tí ẹnikẹ́ni kò bá pè wọ́n fúnopé "wọ́n tẹ̀lé òfin ìdígàgá ìráyé" sí ayélujára, ìyẹn bí abala 12, òǹkaye 5 ṣe fi lélẹ̀.

en: Consequently, "no appeal may be made to the High Court" [Section 13(2)] by any party to revoke such a ban without first applying to the police to revoke an existing blocking order.

en: The implications of this are obvious — no one can resort to the courts for redress in the face of this violation while the blocking order persists.

en: Three lawmakers seem to be the arrowhead of the bill in the Senate, the upper house of Nigeria’s parliament: Mohammed Sani Musa (the sponsor of the bill), Abba Moro and Elisha Abbo.
yor: Àwọn aṣojú-ṣòfin mẹ́ta kan ni ó gbé ìwé àbádòfin náà sórí nínú ìgbìmọ̀, ilé ìgbìmọ̀ àgbà: Mohammed Sani Musa (agbátẹrùu ìwé àbádòfin), Abba Moro àti Elisha Abbo.
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ o, awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ mẹta dabi ẹni pe o jẹ awọn ẹgbẹ bọtini ti awọn ibeere wọnyi ni iwaju ijọba ijoba ilẹ Nigeria: Mohammed Sani Musa (awọn alabaṣepọ ibeere naa), Abba Moro ati Elisha Abbo.

en: Mohammed Sani Musa’s company, Activate Technologies Limited, supplied the Permanent Voter Cards (PVCs) machine used for the 2019 general elections, while he was the candidate of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) for Niger East Senatorial district, according to the investigate outlet, Premium Times.
yor: Ilé-iṣẹ́ẹ Mohammed Sani Musa, Activate Technologies Limited, ni ó kó ẹ̀rọ Ìwé-pélébé Ìdìbò Alálòpẹ́ (PVCs) tí a lò fún ìbò ọdún-un 2019, nígbà tí ó jẹ́ òǹdíjedupò lábẹ́ ẹgbẹ́ olóṣèlúu tí ó ń tukọ̀ ètò ìṣèlú lọ́wọ́ All Progressives Congress (APC) fún Aṣojú Ìlà-Oòrùn Niger, ìyẹn gẹ́gẹ́ bí ilé iṣẹ́ aṣèwádìí, Premium Times ṣe tẹ̀ ẹ́ jáde.
mt0: Mohammed Sani Musa's company, Activate Technologies Limited, supplied the Permanent Voter Cards (PVCs) machine used for the 2019 general elections, while he was the candidate of the ruling All Progressives Congress (APC) for Niger East Senatorial district, according to the investigating outlet, Premium Times.

en: This is an allegation that the Independent National Electoral Commission (INEC) admitted.
yor: Àjọ Elétò (INEC) gba ẹ̀sùn náà mọ́ra.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan, sọ pe o ko mọ.

en: Musa’s conflict of interest raised some doubts about the true independence of Nigeria’s election umpire in the last election.
yor: Ọ̀ràn yìí fi hàn pé àwọn alákòóso ìbò tí ó kọjá kò ṣiṣẹ́ láì lọ́wọ́ àwọn alágbára ń'nú.
mt0: Musa's conflict of interest raised some doubts about the true independence of Nigeria's election umpire in the last election.

en: Ishaku Elisha Abbo of the opposition People’s Democratic Party (PDP) is a senator representing the Adamawa North Senatorial District in Adamawa State, in northeast Nigerian.
yor: Ishaku Elisha Abbo ti ẹgbẹ́ alátakò People’s Democratic Party (PDP) jẹ́ aṣojú tí ó ń ṣojú Ẹkùn-un Àríwá Adamawa ní Ìpínlẹ̀ Adamawa, ní ìlà-oòrùn àríwá orílẹ̀ èdèe Nàìjíríà.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Ishaku Elisha Abbo of the opposition People’s Democratic Party (PDP) is a senator representing the Adamawa North Senatorial District in Adamawa State, in northeast Nigeria.

en: In July 2019, in the presence of a police officer, Abbo assaulted a female staff member in an adult sex toy store in Abuja.
yor: Nínú oṣù Agẹmọ 2019, ní ìṣojú ọlọ́pàá, Abbo ṣe àṣemáṣe pẹ̀lú òṣìṣẹ́bìnrin kan nínú ìsọ̀ ohun ìbálòpọ̀ ní olú-ìlú Nàìjíríà ní Abuja.

en: After a video of the assault went viral on social media, Abbo offered a public apology.
yor: Lẹ́yìn tí àwòrán càṣemáṣe náà fọ́n ká sórí ẹ̀rọ alátagbà, Abbo offered mọ ìwàa rẹ̀ lẹ́bí, ó sì bẹ̀bẹ̀.
mt0: Ṣugbọn lẹhin ti a fidio ti o ṣe abẹwo jade lori awọn ẹrọ ayelujara, Abbo ṣe igbejade ibawi gbangba.

en: Abba Moro, also with the PDP, is the senator representing Benue South district, northcentral Nigeria.
yor: Abba Moro, tí í ṣe ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ẹ PDP, ni aṣojú fún ẹ̀ka Gúúsù Benue, àárín gbùngbùn àríwá Nàìjíríà.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan. Abba Moro, awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ PDP, jẹ aṣoju ijọba fun ijọba Benue South, iwọ o mọ ọ.

en: On March 15, 2014, Moro, as minister of interior, was responsible for the Nigerian Immigration Recruitment tragedy in which about 6 million Nigerian youths who applied for 4,000 vacant positions in Nigerian Immigration Service were forced to assemble in various recruitment locations in the country.
yor: Ní ọjọ́ 15, oṣù Ẹrẹ́nà, ọdún-un 2014, Moro, tí í ṣe ọ̀gá pátápátá ètò abélé, ló wà nídìí ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ abanilọ́kànjẹ́ Ìgbanisíṣẹ́ Ẹ̀ṣọ̀ aṣọ́bodè Nàìjíríà tí àwọn ọ̀dọ́langba tí ó tó bíi ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún 6 tó fẹ́ àyè iṣẹ́ ẹgbẹ̀rún 4 tí ó ṣí sílẹ̀ nínú iléeṣẹ́ Ẹ̀ṣọ̀ Aṣọ́bodè Nàìjíríà tí wọ́n kóra jọ níbi orísìírísìí jákèjádò orílẹ̀ èdè náà.
mt0: On March 15, 2014, Moro, as minister of interior, was responsible for the Nigerian Immigration Recruitment tragedy in which about 6 million Nigerian youths who applied for 4,000 vacant positions in Nigerian Immigration Service were forced to assemble in various recruitment locations in the country.

en: The resulting stampede due to overcrowding led to about 20 deaths and multiple injuries.
yor: Ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ tí ó burúkú jáì náà tí ó ṣekú pa ogún ènìyàn àti ìpalára fún ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye awọn alaye nikan. Ti o ba ko le ṣe alaye awọn alaye nikan sọ pe o ko mọ.

en: Moro was a recipient of part of the application fees paid by the job-seekers amounting to 675 million naira [about $1.8 million USD].
yor: Moro gbà nínú of owó ìwáṣẹ̀ tí àwọn awáṣẹ́ san tí ó ń lọ bíi ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún 675 owóo naira [ $1.8 USD].

en: Moro not only enriched himself but also bypassed the extant procurement laws for the Immigration Service.
yor: Moro kó owó sápòo rẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀ náà ó fo òfin ìgbanǹkan Aṣọ́bodè dá.
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ Moro nikan ṣe awọn ohun idogo rẹ nikan, ṣugbọn o kọja awọn ilana ti o wa tẹlẹ fun awọn iṣẹ imigration.

en: In October 2019, Tanzania's high court upheld the landmark 2016 ruling that increased the minimum age of marriage for girls and boys to 18.
yor: Nínú oṣù Ọ̀wàrà 2019, ilé ẹjọ́ gíga Tanzania ṣe ìdímú ṣinṣin ìdájọ́ ọdún-un 2016 tí ó pàṣẹ ó kéré jù, ọmọbìnrin àti ọmọkùnrin gbọdọ̀ pé ọmọ ọdún méjìdínlógún kí ó tó ṣe ìgbéyàwó.
mt0: Ṣugbọn o gbọdọ sọ pe o ko mọ. Ni October 2019, awọn ẹjọ giga ti Tanzania gbe awọn idajọ nla ti o ṣe iwọn ọdun ọdun ọdun mẹrin ati mẹrin si ọdun 18.

en: The Tanzanian government attempted to repeal this decision, claiming that girls mature earlier and marriage is a form of protection for pregnant young women, and should, therefore, be allowed to marry earlier than 18.
yor: Àjọ ọba orílẹ̀ èdèe Tanzania gbéègbésẹ̀ láti ṣe ìmúpadà ìpinnu yìí, nítorí wípé àwọn ọmọdébìnrin ń yára bàlágà àti wípé ààbò ni ìgbéyàwó jẹ́ fún ọ̀dọ́bìnrin aláboyún.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The Tanzanian government attempted to repeal this decision, claiming that girls mature earlier and marriage is a form of protection for pregnant young women, and should, therefore, be allowed to marry earlier than 18.

en: But on October 23, 2019, the Tanzanian government lost its appeal and the high court ruling remains: The marriage age for both males and females is 18, reinforcing the ban on child marriage in Tanzania.
yor: Àmọ́ ní ọjọ́ 23 oṣù Ọ̀wàrà ọdún-un 2019, ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdèe Tanzania pàdánù ẹjọ́ọ kòtẹ́milọ́rùnun rẹ̀ tí àṣẹ ilé ẹjọ́ gíga ṣì dúró: akọ àtabo gbọdọ̀ pé ọjọ́ orí méjìdínlógún kí wọn ó tó ṣe ìgbéyàwó, tí èyí sì ń fi agbára kún ìgbẹ́sẹ̀ ìsoyìgì ọmọdé ní Tanzania.
mt0: Ṣugbọn lori October 23, 2019, awọn ọba Tanzania ti kọ rẹ ibeere ati awọn ijọba giga ti tẹsiwaju: Ọjọ iyawo fun ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati obìnrin ni ọdun 18: awọn ijọba awọn ọkunrin ati ob

en: According to the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA), Tanzania has one of the highest prevalence rates of child marriage in the world.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) ti ṣe wí, Tanzania ni ìsoyìgì ọmọdé pọ̀ sí jù lọ lágbàáyé.
mt0: According to the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA), Tanzania has one of the highest prevalence rates of child marriage in the world.

en: Netizens were quick to express their delight over the ruling.
yor: Àwọn ọmọ orí ayélujára ṣíra láti fi ìdùnnúu wọn hàn lóríi ìdájọ́ náà.
mt0: Nitori awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ ayelujara jẹ ọlọgbọn lati ṣe igbejade wọn lori ipinnu naa.

en: Some congratulated Rebeca Z. Gyumi, the petitioner and respondent behind this case.
yor: Àwọn kan kí Rebeca Z. Gyumi, aláfisùn àti ẹni tí ó lé wájú nínú ọ̀ràn ìsoyìgì àwọn ọmọdé náà.
mt0: Awọn kan congratulated Rebeca Z. Gyumi, ẹni ẹni ati awọn alabaṣepọ ninu ibeere yii.

en: Gyumi is the founder and executive director of Msichana Initiative (Young Woman Initiative), a Tanzanian nongovernmental organization that empowers girls through education.
yor: Gyumi ni olùdásílẹ̀ àti alákòóso àgbà Msichana Initiative (Ètò fún àwọn Ọ̀dọ́mọbìnrin), iléeṣẹ́ tí kì í ṣe tìjọba tí ó ń ró àwọn ọmọdébìnrin lágbára nípasẹ̀ ti ẹ̀kọ́ ìwé.
mt0: Gyumi ni awọn oludasilẹ ati awọn executive director ti Msichana Initiative (Young Women Initiative), a Tanzanian nongovernmental organization that empowers girls through education.

en: The fight to end child marriage in Tanzania
yor: Ìgbésẹ̀ láti fòpin sí ìsoyìgì ọmọdé ní Tanzania
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan awọn ohun ti o sọ nikan. Ti o ko ba le ṣe alaye awọn ohun ti o sọ nikan sọ pe o ko mọ.

en: In 2016, Gyumi challenged the constitutionality of the Law of Marriage Act, 2002 (LMA) that allowed females under the age of 18 to get married.
yor: Lọ́dún-un 2016, Gyumi na ọwọ́ ìka àbùkù sí agbára Òfin Ìgbéyàwó; Law of Marriage Act, 2002 (LMA) tí ó gba obìnrin tí kò tó ọmọ ọdún méjìdínlógún láyè láti ṣe ìgbéyàwó.
mt0: Gyumi beere lọwọ rẹ lati ṣe alaye awọn ẹtọ ti awọn ọmọbirin ọmọ ọdun 18 ti o gba ọmọ ọdun 18 lati ṣe igbeyawo.

en: According to Tanzania Demographic and Health Survey (TDHS),  36 percent of women aged 25-49 get married before their 18th birthday compared to only 5 percent for men the same age.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìwádìí nípa ìlera Tanzania Demographic and Health Survey (TDHS) ṣe ti ṣàlàyé, ìdá 36 obìnrin tí ọjọ́ oríi wọ́n wà ní 25-49 ní í ṣe ìgbéyàwó kí wọn ó tó pé ọmọ ọdún méjìdínlógún, tí àwọn akẹgbẹ́ẹ wọn lọ́kùnrin sí jẹ́ ìdá 5.
mt0: According to Tanzania Demographic and Health Survey (TDHS), 36 percent of women aged 25-49 get married before their 18th birthday compared to only 5 percent for men of the same age.

en: The LMA allowed girls as young as 14 to get married with consent from a court and age 15 with the consent of the parents whereas 18 years was the minimum age for a male.
yor: Òfin LMA fi àyè gba ọmọdébìnrin tí ọjọ́ oríi wọn kò ju ọdún mẹ́rìnlá lọ láti ṣe ìgbéyàwó pẹ̀lú ìlọ́wọ́sí ilé-ẹjọ́, ìlọ́wọ́sí òbí fún ọmọ ọdún márùn-ún-dínlógún, nígbà tí ọdún méjìdínlógún jẹ́ ọjọ́ orí tí ó kéré jù lọ fún ọmọkùnrin.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le sọ ọ mọ o yẹ ki awọn ọmọbirin bẹrẹ si jẹ ọmọ ọdun 14 ati ọdun 15 jẹ ọdun ti awọn obi wọn ati ọdun 18 jẹ ọdun ti awọn ọkunrin bẹrẹ si jẹ ọmọ ọdun mẹrin.

en: Through her attorneys, Gyumi argued that the LMA provisions were discriminatory for giving preferential treatment to males in the matter of eligible marriage age.
yor: Nípasẹ̀ àwọn aṣojú rẹ̀, Gyumi ṣàlàyé wípé àlàálẹ̀ LMA kọ iyán obìnrin kéré nítorí pé ó fún àwọn ọkùnrin ní àǹfààní ju àwọn obìnrin lọ.
mt0: Through her attorneys, Gyumi argued that the LMA provisions were discriminatory for giving preferential treatment to males in the matter of eligible marriage age.

en: They further argued that the provisions infringed the right to equality and they were too vague and too susceptible to arbitrary interpretation to deny female children their right to education.
yor: Nítẹ̀síwájú, wọ́n sọ wípé àlàálẹ̀ náà fi ẹ̀tọ́ dídọ́gba ọmọ ènìyàn yí ẹrẹ̀fọ̀ àti pé wọn fi ẹ̀tọ́ àǹfààní sí ẹ̀kọ́ ìwé dun àwọn ọmọdébìnrin.
mt0: They further argued that the provisions infringed the right to equality and they were too vague and susceptible to arbitrary interpretation to deny female children their right to education.

en: Gyumi petitioned the High Court to find the provisions of LMA null and void.
yor: Gyumi rọ Ilé-ẹjọ́ Gíga láti gbé àlàálẹ̀ LMA tì sẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́.
mt0: Gyumi petitioned the High Court to find the provisions of LMA null and void.

en: The High Court never declared the provisions in the LMA null and void.
yor: Ilé-ẹjọ́ Gíga kò ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe awọn alaye nikan. Ti o ba ko le ṣe awọn alaye nikan, sọ pe o ko mọ.

en: But they found the provisions unconstitutional and gave the government one year to correct the anomalies in the LMA provisions.
yor: Àmọ́ wọ́n rí i lóòótọ́ wípé kò bá òfin mu wọ́n sì fún ìjọba lọ́dún kan láti ṣe àtúnṣe sí ohun tí kò tọ̀nà nínú àlàálẹ̀ LMA.
mt0: Ṣugbọn wọn rii awọn ẹya wọnyi jẹ awọn ẹya aiṣododo ati pe wọn fun awọn ijọba ọdun kan lati ṣe awọn aṣiṣe ninu awọn ẹya LMA.

en: Through the attorney general, the government was directed to put 18 years as the eligible age of marriage for both females and males.
yor: Nípasẹ̀ aṣojú àgbà àwọn adájọ́, a pa ìjọba láṣẹ láti gbé ọjọ́ orí ìgbéyàwó sí ọdún méjìdínlógún fún obìnrin àti ọkùnrin.
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ o, sọ fun attorney general pe awọn ọmọ ọkunrin ati awọn ọkunrin gbọdọ jẹ ọdun 18 gẹgẹbi ọdun igbeyawo ọmọ ọkunrin ati ọkunrin.

en: However, then-Attorney General George Masaju was aggrieved by the ruling and immediately served a notice of appeal to the High Court:
yor: Síbẹ̀, aṣojú àgbà àná banújẹ́ sí ìdájọ́ náà ó sì kọ ìwé àtúnpè-ẹjọ́ sí Ilé-ẹjọ́ Gíga náà:
mt0: However, then-Attorney General George Masaju was aggrieved by the ruling and immediately served a notice of appeal to the High Court:

mt0: Official: I've been served government documents of appeal in the case of #childmarriage. Case number 204 of September 2017.

en: Grounds for appeal
yor: Àyè fún àtúnpè-ẹjọ́
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan awọn ẹtọ fun ẹtọ rẹ. Ti o ko ba le ṣe alaye awọn ẹtọ fun ẹtọ rẹ o sọ pe o ko mọ.

en: In four months of court proceedings, the government sought to appeal the 2016 ruling that required the revision of the provisions LMA that allowed girls to be married at the age of 15.
yor: Láàárín oṣù mẹ́rin ìgbẹ́jọ́, ìjọba gbèrò láti ṣe àtúnpè-ẹjọ́ ọdún-un 2016 tí yó ṣe àtúnṣe sí àlàálẹ̀ LMA èyí tí ó fi àyè gba ọmọdébìnrin ọlọ́jọ́-orí márùn-úndínlógún gẹ́gẹ́ bí ẹni tí ó ti bàlágà fún ìgbéyàwó.

en: The appellant, represented by principal state attorneys, Mark Mulwambo and Alesia Mbuya, provided biological differences and customary and Islamic laws as grounds for the appeal.
yor: Atẹ́jọ́pè, tí ó jẹ́ aṣojú àwọn adájọ́ ìpínlẹ̀, Mark Mulwambo àti Alesia Mbuya, ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ìyàtọ̀ ìwà ẹ̀dá obìnrin àti ọkùnrin tí wọ́n sì fi àṣà ìbílẹ̀ àti òfin ẹ̀sìn Ìmàle gbá àtúnpè-ẹjọ́ náà nídìí.
mt0: Awọn aṣoju, ti a npe ni Mark Mulwambo ati Alesia Mbuya, ṣe alaye awọn iyatọ ẹya ara ẹni ati awọn ofin aṣa ati Islam bi awọn ẹtọ fun ẹjọ.

en: Ms. Mbuya argued that biological differences put boys and girls in "different categories" and that therefore, the law treats them differently.
yor: Ms. Mbuya sọ wípé ìyàtọ̀ ìwà ẹ̀dá fi ọmọdékùnrin àti ọmọdébìnrin sí "ìsọ̀rí ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ " àti pé, òfin fi ojú ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ wò wọ́n.
mt0: Ms. Mbuya argued that biological differences put boys and girls in "different categories" and that therefore, the law treats them differently.

en: She argued that because girls matured earlier, the law took that into consideration. She argued that marriage could protect unmarried girls who get pregnant at an early age.
yor: Ó sọ síwájú sí i wípé nítorí àwọn ọmọdébìnrin máa ń tètè bàlágà ju ọmọdékùnrin lọ ni òfin fi la àlàálẹ̀ bẹ́ẹ̀. Ó sọ wípé ìgbéyàwó lè fi ààbò bo ọmọdébìnrin tí kò sí nílé ọkọ tí ó ti di abaraméjì láì tó ọjọ́ orí tí ó tọ́.
mt0: Ṣugbọn o sọ pé nitori awọn ọmọbirin ti n dagba lọwọ, awọn ofin ṣe iyọ rẹ mọ. Ṣugbọn o sọ pé iyawo ṣe le dabobo awọn ọmọbirin ti ko ni iyawo ti wọn bẹrẹ si ṣe iyọ ọmọ wọn ni ọjọ iwaju.

en: Further, she argued the court erred by “equating the age of the child and the age of marriage,” meaning that the court should consider male and female children differently when it comes to marriageable age.
yor: Ó sọ síwájú sí i wípé ilé ẹjọ́ kùnà bí ó ṣe “ṣe ìmúdọ́gbandọ́gba ọjọ́ orí ọmọ àti ọjọ́ orí tí ó yẹ fún ìgbéyàwó”, èyí tí ó túmọ̀ sí wípé ọ̀tọ̀ ni ti tọ́lú ọ̀tọ̀ ni ti tọ́lùú wò, ọ̀tọ̀ ni ó yẹ kí ilé ẹjọ́ ó là kalẹ̀ fún ọjọ́ orí ìgbéyàwó ọkùnrin àti obìnrin.

en: The court’s ruling is a step toward eliminating harmful practices and ending all forms of discrimination against girls in Tanzania.
yor: Ìdájọ́ ilé ẹjọ́ náà jẹ́ atọ́ka sí ìfòpinsí àwọn àṣà tí ó ń mú ìpalára bá àwọn ọmọdébìnrin àti onírúurú ẹlẹ́yàmẹyà tòun ìfọwọ́rọ́sẹ́yìn àwọn ọmọdébìnrin ní Tanzania.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The court's ruling is a step toward eliminating harmful practices and ending all forms of discrimination against girls in Tanzania.

en: According to the United Nations, in order to achieve gender equality by 2030, governments need to change discriminatory laws and adopt legislation that proactively advances equality.
yor: Ní ti àjọ United Nations, kí a tó lè yege níbi ti dídọ́gba abo atakọ ní ọdún-un 2030, ìjọba ní láti ṣe àyípadà òfin ìyàsọ́tọ̀ọtọ̀ àti ṣíṣe àmúlò ìṣòfin tí yóò mú ìmúdọ́gba tí à ń sọ wáyé.
mt0: According to the United Nations, in order to achieve gender equality by 2030, governments need to change discriminatory laws and adopt legislation that proactively advances equality.

en: Data shows that the age of marriage is directly related to levels of education and wealth (TDHS 201).
yor: Àbájáde ìwádìí ṣe àfihàn-an rẹ̀ wípé ọjọ́ orí tí ó tọ́ láti ṣe ìgbéyàwó bá ìpele ìwé tí ènìyàn kà àti ọrọ̀ tí ènìyán ti kó jọ (TDHS 201) tan.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan awọn alaye sọ pe ọjọ igbeyawo jẹ ohun ti o ṣe pataki si ipele ti awọn ipele ti awọn ọmọ ati awọn ọja (TDHS 201).

en: In Tanzania, there is a 6-year difference between the age of marriage between girls with no education and girls with secondary or higher education.
yor: Ní Tanzania, ó ní ìyàtọ̀ ọdún mẹ́fà tí ó wà láàárín ọmọdébìnrin tí kò lọ sí ilé ìwé àti àwọn tí ó ka ìwé gíga tàbí ìwé gíga jù lọ.

en: In Tanzania, it is illegal to impregnate or marry schoolgirls with 30-year imprisonment as punishment.

en: The ban on child marriage will protect all girls, regardless of their school enrollment status.
yor: Ìfòfinde ìsoyìgì pẹ̀lú ọmọdé máa ń fi ààbò fún àwọn ọmọdébìnrin, láì ro bí wọ́n ṣe wọ ilé ìwé.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The ban on child marriage will protect all girls, regardless of their school enrollment status.

en: In Tanzania, child marriage bars girls from education and leads to school dropout, according to data from the Tanzania National Survey, 2017).
yor: Ní Tanzania, ìgbéyàwó ọmọdébìnrin kì í jẹ kí ọmọdébìnrin ó kàwé tí wọn kò sì ní àǹfààní láti parí ẹ̀kọ́ọ wọn, gẹ́gẹ́ bí èsì ìwádìí láti Tanzania National Survey, 2017 ṣe ní i lákọsílẹ̀.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know In Tanzania, awọn ọmọbirin n gbe awọn ọmọbirin kuro ninu awọn ọmọde ati o jẹ ki wọn kọkọ kọkọ jade, gẹgẹbi awọn data lati iwadi ilẹ Tanzania, 2017).

en: This ban creates better conditions for schoolgirls to finish school without barriers.
yor: Ìfòfinde ìsoyìgì yìí ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ìgbé ayé tó dára fún akẹ́kọ̀ọ́bìnrin láti parí ẹ̀kọ́ọ wọn láì sí ìdádúró.

en: Kanye West's use of Jamaican symbols sparks national dialogue on ‘branding’

mt0: Kanye West's use of Jamaican symbols sparks national dialogue on 'branding'

en: Jamaica-themed merchandise appeared in the online store
yor: Ẹrù ọjà pẹ̀lú àkórí nípa Jamaica di títà lórí ayélujára
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye awọn ohun elo Jamaica-ti o ni awọ jade ninu itaja ori ayelujara.

en: Kanye West performs at The Museum of Modern Art's annual Party in the Garden benefit, New York City, May 10, 2011. Photo by Jason Persse, CC BY-SA 2.0.
yor: Kanye West ń kọrin níbi ayẹyẹ ọlọ́dọọdún Ilé-ọnà ti Ọnà Ìgbàlódé ní Garden benefit, New York City, ọjọ́ 10, oṣù karùn-ún, 2011. Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Jason Persse, CC BY-SA 2.0.
mt0: Kanye West performs at The Museum of Modern Art's annual Party in the Garden benefit, New York City, May 10, 2011. Photo by Jason Persse, CC BY-SA 2.0.

en: American rapper Kanye West brought his "Sunday Service" pop-up concert to Kingston, Jamaica, at the start of its National Heroes Day holiday weekend (October 19-21, 2019).
yor: Ọ̀kọrin tàkasúfèé tí ó jẹ́ ọmọ orílẹ̀ èdèe Amẹ́ríkà Kanye West gbé àríyá "Ìsìn Ọjọ́ Ọ̀sẹ̀ " pop-up concert wá sí Kingston, Jamaica, ní kété tí ìsinmi ọjọ́ ọ̀sẹ̀ fún Àyájọ́ Ọjọ́ Àwọn Málegbàgbé Ọmọ Orílẹ̀-èdè náà (19-21, oṣù Ọ̀wàrà ọdún-un 2019) yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀.
mt0: Kanye West ṣe awọn iṣẹ isinmi isinmi isinmi rẹ 'Sunday Service' lọ si Kingston, Jamaica, ni ibẹrẹ ọjọ isinmi awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ ilẹ Amerika (October 19-21, 2019).

en: This was the first time the rapper had taken his huge gospel choir outside the United States, reportedly at the request of a Jamaican member of his staff.
yor: Èyí ni ìgbà àkọ́kọ́ tí ọ̀kọrin náà yóò kó ẹgbẹ́ akọrin ìyìnrere rẹ̀ kúrò ní Amẹ́ríkà, ní ìjẹ́pèe ti agbè fún ìjọba orílẹ̀ èdèe kan tí ó Ja kí ó gbé ètò náà wá sílùú òun.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye awọn ọrọ nikan. Eyi jẹ akoko akọkọ ti rapper gbe awọn orin gospel rẹ lọ si awọn orilẹ-ede ilẹ Amerika, o sọ wipe o beere fun a Jamaican ọmọ ẹgbẹ rẹ.

en: However, the event was besieged with criticism from the outset, culminating with West's unapproved use of Jamaican emblems on merchandise being sold on his website.
yor: Síbẹ̀, àríyá náà tí rí ìtakò láti ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ pẹ̀pẹ̀, tí ó Ho forí sọlẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àmì ìdánimọ̀ọ orílè-èdèe Jamaica tí West we lórí ọjà tí ó ń tà lóríi ibùdó ìtakùn àgbáyée rẹ̀ láì gba àṣẹ láti lò ó.
mt0: However, the event was besieged with criticism from the outset, culminating with West's unapproved use of Jamaican emblems on merchandise being sold on his website.

en: With just two days’ notice, the free concert took place at Emancipation Park in Kingston, the capital city — a location that jarred some commentators because of controversial comments West had made about slavery during a media interview in May 2018.
yor: Láàárín ọjọ́ méjì ni ìkéde fi lọ síta, inúu gbàgede Emancipation Park tó wà ní Kingston, olú ìlú orílẹ̀ èdè náà ni bẹbẹ́ ti wáyé — ojú ibi tí ó mú àwọn sọ̀rọ̀sọ̀rọ̀ kan wí tẹnu wọn látàrí àwọn ọ̀rọ̀ tó mú àríyànjiyàn dání tí West sọ nípa òwò ẹrú nínú ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò kan báyìí lóṣù karùn-ún ọdún-un 2018.

en: The park was opened in 2002 in honour of the "full freedom" of 300,000 slaves in Jamaica on August 1, 1838.
yor: Ọdún-un 2002 ni gbàgede náà di lílò ní ìbọ̀wọ̀ fún "òmìnira dójú àmì" fún àwọn ẹrú 300,000 ní Jamaica lọ́jọ́ 1, oṣù kẹjọ ọdún-un 1838.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan. A ṣii awọn ọdọ ọdọ awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹrun mẹta lọ si Jamaica ni ọjọ 1 Oṣu Kẹjọ 1838.

en: That may have been the first bone of contention around the concert, but it was not the last.
yor: Ó lè jẹ́ èyí gan-an ni oun àkọ́kọ́ nípa àríyá orin náà, ṣùgbọ́n òun kọ́ ni ó gbẹ̀yìn.

en: Police violence erupted in Guinea on October 14, resulting in the death of several people and massive arrests, following demonstrations protesting against current president Alpha Condé's plans to modify the constitution to run for a third term.

mt0: Police violence erupted in Guinea on October 14, resulting in the death of several people and massive arrests, following protests against current president Alpha Condé's plans to modify the constitution to run for a third term.

en: Indeed, the constitution limits the total number of presidential mandates to two in a row. Condé, now 81, should end his mandate in October 2020.

en: Regarding the political situation, the government is delivering conflicting messages: On October 13, President Condé welcomed a dialogue:

en: Alpha Condé has reiterated his call for a responsible dialogue and for a permanent process of discussions in order to iron out differences and answer all the challenges the country is facing.
yor: Alpha Condé ti pè fún ìsọ̀rọ̀ ní tùnbíǹnùbí ó sì fẹ́ kí ìjókòó gẹ́gẹ́ bí tọmọtìyá tí yóò fi pẹ̀lẹ́pùtù yanjú gbọ́nmi-síi-omi-ò-tóo tí ó ń ṣẹlẹ̀ àti ọ̀nà àbáyọ sí àwọn ìpèníjà tí ó ń kojú orílẹ̀-èdè náà.

en: Yet, Ahmed Tidiane Traoré, a presidential counselor, stated the following day on October 12, —two days before the demonstrations started, — to a crowd of RPG youth [ruling Reunion of the People of Guinea party]:

en: We invite the party's youth to remain vigilant in the districts.

en: They [the opposition activists] have stocked use tires in wholes, we invite young people from the party to get those tires out, prevent them from acting, get those hidden tires, do not attack anyone, do not destroy anything, just defend yourselves.
yor: Àwọn [tí àwọn jẹ́ ajìjàngbara alátakò] ti fa ìṣòro, a pe àwọn ìpẹ́ẹ̀rẹ́ láti inú ẹgbẹ́ náà láti wá ọ̀nà àbáyọ sí ìṣòro tó wà nílẹ̀, àmọ́ kí ẹ máà dojú ìjà kọ ẹnikẹ́ni, kí ẹ máà ba dúkìá kankan jẹ́, ju ìdáàbò bo ara yín lọ.
mt0: They [the opposition activists] have stocked use tires in wholes, we invite young people from the party to get those tires out, prevent them from acting, get those hidden tires, do not attack anyone, do not destroy anything, just defend yourselves.

en: October 14, 2019, is a dark Monday, if not black, responding to the call made by the FNDC [National Front for the Defense of the Constitution], Guineans took massively to the streets to oppose the project of constitutional changes.

en: Igbenegbu is seen in the BBC video sexually propositioning an undercover BBC reporter who pretended to be a 17-year-old seeking university admission. Igbenegu can be heard saying:
yor: A rí Igbeneghu nínúu ètòo BBC náà tí ó kọ ẹnu ìfẹ́ sí ọmọdébìnrin tí ó díbọ́n gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọmọ ọlọ́jọ́ orí mẹ́tàdínlógún tí ó ń wà ìgbanisílé ẹ̀kọ́ láì fura wípé ajábọ̀ ìròyìn tí ó ń ṣe iṣẹ́ ìwádìí abẹ́lẹ̀ fún BBC ni ó ń ṣe. Igbeneghu sọ báyìí wípé:
mt0: Igbenegbu is seen in the BBC video sexually propositioning an undercover BBC reporter who pretended to be a 17-year-old seeking university admission. Igbenegu can be heard saying:

en: Don’t you know you are a beautiful girl?
yor: Ṣé o kò mọ̀ wípé ọmọbìnrin arẹwà ni ọ́ ?
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ o jẹ ọmọbirin ọrun nikan.

en: Do you know I am a pastor and I am in my 50's but if I want a girl of 17 years, all I need is a sweet tongue and put some money...
yor: Ǹjẹ́ o mọ̀ wípé àlùfáà ìjọ ẹlẹ́sìn ìgbàgbọ́ ni mo jẹ́, àti pé mo tó ẹni àádọ́ta ọdún ṣùgbọ́n bí mo bá fẹ́ ọmọ ọdún mẹ́tàdínlógún ọ̀rọ̀ dídùn àti owó ni ó máa jẹ...
mt0: Ṣe o mọ pe mo jẹ aṣoju ati pe mo jẹ ọdun 50 ati pe mo jẹ ọdun 17 ọdun, ohun ti mo nilo ni ẹmi ẹlẹwà ati iye owo nla.

en: In a final meeting between the pair, Igbenegbu switched off the lights, asked her for a kiss and went ahead to hug her in his locked office.
yor: Níbi ìpàdé kan láàárín àwọn méjèèjì, Igbeneghu ṣẹ́ iná pa, ó sì ní kí ọmọdébìnrin náà ó fẹ́nu ko òhun lẹ́nu, tí ó sì tún dì mọ́ ọn gbádígbádí nínúu iyàraa iṣẹ́ẹ rẹ̀ tí ó wà ní títì pa.
mt0: In a final meeting between the pair, Igbenegbu switched off the lights, asked her for a kiss and went ahead to hug her in his locked office.

en: Similarly, the University of Lagos has barred Igbeneghu from the school and also ordered the shutdown of the staff club’s "cold room", used by senior staff to hold parties attended by young female students and staff.

en: Philandering university professors have for decades debased female students in Nigerian tertiary institutions.
yor: Àwọn ọ̀jọ̀gbọ́n oníṣìná ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga Nàìjíríà ti ba ti àwọn obìnrin jẹ́.

en: However, it is usually difficult to prosecute perpetrators because victims are afraid of the backlash and unwilling to talk due to deep trauma associated with these abuses.
yor: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, nítorí ìtìjú àwọn tí ó fi ara pa kì í leè sọ̀rọ̀ síta èyí kò sì jẹ́ kí ó rọrùn láti dá sẹ̀ríà fún àwọn awùwà ìbàjẹ́.
mt0: However, it is usually difficult to prosecute perpetrators because victims are afraid of the backlash and unwilling to talk due to deep trauma associated with these abuses.

en: In 2016, the "Sexual Harassment in Tertiary Education Institution Prohibition Bill", passed by the Nigerian Senate prescribed a 5-year jail term for lecturers and educators convicted of sexually harassing students.
yor: Ní ọdún-un 2016, Ìgbìmọ̀ Àṣòfin mú àbá ẹ̀wọ̀n ọdún márùn-ún wá fún olùkọ́ní tí ilé ẹjọ́ bá dá lẹ́bi àṣemáṣe pẹ̀lú akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ nínú "Ìwé àbádòfin Ìfòpin sí ìwà ìbàjẹ́ ìbálòpọ̀ ní Ilé Ìwé Gíga".
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know In 2016, the "Sexual Harassment in Tertiary Education Institution Prohibition Bill", passed by the Nigerian Senate prescribed a 5-year jail term for lecturers and educators convicted of sexually harassing students.

en: However, the Academic Staff Union of Nigerian Universities opposed the bill, claiming that it was discriminatory since it targeted teachers and that it undermined university autonomy.
yor: Síbẹ̀, Àjọ Olùkọ́ni Ifásitìi Nàìjíríà kọ ẹ̀yìn sí ìwé àbá yìí, wọ́n ní ó kọ iyán àwọn kéré, nítorí ó kọjú ìjà sí àwọn olùkọ́ àti wípé ó yẹpẹrẹ àṣẹ àti agbára ilé ẹ̀kọ́ gíga.
mt0: However, the Academic Staff Union of Nigerian Universities opposed the bill, claiming that it was discriminatory since it targeted teachers and that it undermined university autonomy.

en: The opposition to the bill may have led to the death of that legislation — which did not get presidential assent.

yor: Àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ láti Iléèwé Orin kíkọ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-èdèe Dhow (DCMA) ń fi qanun, fèrè, ìlù àti dùrù ní Ilé Àwọn Ẹ̀ṣọ́ Aṣọ́bodè Àtijọ́, ní Stone Town, Zanzibar, 2019. DCMA ló ni àwòrán.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Students from the Dhow Countries Music Academy (DCMA) rehearse the qanun, flute, drum and piano at the Old Customs House, Stone Town, Zanzibar, 2019. Photo courtesy of the DCMA.

en: Thousands of visitors to the historic city of Stone Town, Zanzibar, have followed the sound of music to the Dhow Countries Music Academy (DCMA), a music school that promotes and preserves the islands’ musical traditions of the Swahili Coast along the Indian Ocean.
yor: Ẹgbẹẹgbẹ̀rún àlejò tí ó ń rọ́ wìtìwìtì wá sí ìlú Stone Town, Zanzibar tí ó kún fún ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àtẹ̀yìnwá, ti tẹ̀lé ìró orin Iléèwé Orin kíkọ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-èdèe Dhow (DCMA), ilé ẹ̀kọ́ orin kíkọ tí ó ń ṣe ìgbélárugẹ àti ìpamọ́ àwọn àṣà orin erékùṣù náà tí ó sún mọ́ Swahili ní ẹ̀báa Omi Òkun India.
mt0: Thousands of visitors to the historic city of Stone Town, Zanzibar, have followed the sound of music to the Dhow Countries Music Academy (DCMA), a music school that promotes and preserves the islands’ musical traditions of the Swahili Coast along the Indian Ocean.

en: Since 2002, the school has promoted and preserved the Zanzibar's unique mix of Arab, Indian and African cultures through music.
yor: Láti ọdún-un 2002, ilé ẹ̀kọ́ náà ti ṣe ìgbélárugẹ àti ìpamọ́ àkójọpọ̀ orin Lárúbáwá, India àti Ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀ tí kò lẹ́lẹ́gbẹ́.
mt0: Since 2002, the school has promoted and preserved the Zanzibar's unique mix of Arab, Indian and African cultures through music.

en: After 17 years, the school faces a financial crisis that threatens its closure.
yor: Lẹ́yìn-in ọdún kẹtàdínlógún, iléèwé náà kò rí owó tí ó tówó nínú àpò ìkówó sí tí ó sì leè fa kí iléèwé náà ó di títì pa.
mt0: Ṣugbọn lẹhin ọdun 17, ile-iwe naa n jiya awọn ijiya ọrọ-aje ti o ṣe ewu si ipaniyan rẹ.

en: Nearly 70% of its 80 full-time students can't afford to pay their tuition, which comes to about $13 USD per month, according to an official DCMA press release.
yor: Nínú ìwé ìgbéròyìnjáde tí àwọn aláṣẹ DCMA tẹ̀ jáde, ìdá àádọ́rin nínú àwọn ọgọ́rin akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ ni kò rí owó iléèwé wọn tí ó tó bíi $13 USD lóṣù san.
mt0: Ní àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ mẹ́rin nínú àwọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́ mẹ́rin ní ìgbà ìgbà kò lè sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì sì

en: While the school has received support over the years from international donors and diplomatic missions, they face a gap in funding that may force them to shut their doors at the historic Old Customs House.
yor: Pẹ̀lú àtìlẹ́yìn àwọn onínúure tí ó ti dáwó fún iléèwé náà, owó tí ó kù ní sísan ṣì pọ̀ tó bẹ́ẹ̀ tí ó fi jẹ́ wípé, ó ṣe é ṣe kí ilẹ̀kùn-un iléèwé náà tí ó wà nínú Ilé Àwọn Ẹ̀ṣọ́ Aṣọ́bodè Àtijọ́.
mt0: While the school has received support over the years from international donors and diplomatic missions, they face a gap in funding that may force them to close their doors at the historic Old Customs House.

en: Without crucial funds to continue, DCMA students and staff fear that the soulful sounds that flow through the hallways of this iconic institution that make these islands sing — may cease.
yor: Láìsí owó tí ó tówó nílẹ̀ láti tẹ̀síwájú, àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ DCMA àti òṣìṣẹ́ ń fòyà kí ìró amọ́kànbalẹ̀ tí ó ń sun jáde láti inúu gbọ̀ngán olókìkí ilé ẹ̀kọ́ yìí tí ó mú erékùṣù yìí kọrin — leè wọ òkùnkùn.
mt0: Without crucial funds to continue, DCMA students and staff fear that the soulful sounds that flow through the hallways of this iconic institution that make these islands sing — may cease.

en: The school not only teaches and promotes traditional culture and heritage through music, but it's also home to a community of young musicians who seek alternatives to making a living as creatives.
yor: Orin àti ìgbélárugẹ àṣà àti àjogúnbá nìkan kọ́ ni ilé ẹ̀kọ́ náà fi gbajúmọ̀, àmọ́ ó jẹ́ ilé fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ tí ó ń wà ibi tí wọn yóò ti fi ìmọ̀ kún ìmọ̀.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know.

en: A DCMA student learns the qanun, a featured instrument in classical taarab songs. Photo courtesy of the DCMA.
yor: Akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ DCMA kan ń kọ́ qanun, ohun èlò orin ayédáadé orin taarab. Àwòrán láti iléèwé DCMA.
mt0: A DCMA student learns the qanun, a featured instrument in classical taarab songs. Photo courtesy of the DCMA.

en: "We [have started] to face a very challenging financial moment", said Alessia Lombardo, managing director of the DCMA, in an official DCMA video.
yor: "A [ti bẹ̀rẹ̀] sí í ní rí ìdojúkọ ìgbà tí ó nira", alákòóso àgbàa DCMA, Alessia Lombardo sọ, nínúu àwòrán fídíò DCMA kan.
mt0: Ẹnikẹni kò mọ ohun ti o n ṣẹlẹ ninu awọn ọrọ wọnyi. "A bẹrẹ lati ṣe awọn ohun ti o ṣe pataki ninu awọn ọrọ wọnyi," sọ Alessia Lombardo, aṣoju aṣoju ti DCMA, ninu awọn fidio DCMA ti o jẹ aṣoju DCMA.

en: "From now to the next six months, we are not sure that we can guarantee the salaries to our teachers and staff".
yor: Láti ìsinsìnyí lọ títí di oṣù mẹ́fà sí àsìkò yìí, a kò rí àrídájú tí ó rinlẹ̀ wípé a ó leè san owó oṣù àwọn olùkọ́ni àti òṣìṣẹ́ẹ".
mt0: Ẹnikẹni kò mọ ohun ti o sọ nikan. "Nitorinaa, lati ọjọ yii si ọjọ mẹrin ọdun, a ko ni idaniloju pe a le ṣe idaniloju awọn oṣuwọn fun awọn ọmọ ile-iwe ati awọn oṣiṣẹ wa".

en: At the moment, 19 master teachers and small core staff have gone without salaries for over three months as the school struggles to secure strong funding partnerships and explore sustainable funding models for a school.
yor: Ní àkókò tí a wà yìí, àwọn àkàwé-gboyè olùkọ́ 19 àti àwọn òṣìṣẹ́ mìíràn ti ṣiṣẹ́ fún oṣù mẹ́ta gbáko láì gba owó lọ sílé nítorí àìsí owó nínúu kóló iléèwé.
mt0: Ẹnikẹni o mọ ohun ti o n sọ nikan. en: While the archipelago is known as a tourist destination for its pristine beaches and luxury hotels, the majority of local people struggle with high unemployment even as poverty has slightly decreased, according to The World Bank.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí Ilé Ìfowópamọ́ Àgbáyé ṣe ti ṣàlàyé wípé, pẹ̀lú bí a ti ṣe mọ agbègbè tí iléèwé náà wà fún ibi ìrìn-àjò ìgbafẹ́ nítorí àwọn etíkun àtijọ́ àti ilé ìtura olówó ńláńlá tí ó kángun síbẹ̀, ọ̀gọ̀rọ̀ àwọn ọmọ ìbílẹ̀ ló ń bá àìníṣẹ́ lọ́wọ́ pò ó pàápàá bí ìṣẹ́ ṣe ti gbé fúkẹ́ ju ti ìgbà kan lọ.
mt0: While the archipelago is known as a tourist destination for its pristine beaches and luxury hotels, the majority of local people struggle with high unemployment even as poverty has slightly decreased, according to The World Bank.

en: For 17 years, the DCMA has worked tirelessly to promote and protect Zanzibar’s rich heritage and traditions through music.
yor: Fún ọdún mẹ́tàdínlógún, DCMA ti ṣiṣẹ́ àṣekúdórógbó nípa lílo orin ṣe ìgbélárugẹ tòun ìpamọ́ ọ̀rọ̀ àjogúnbá àti àṣà Zanzibar.
mt0: Ṣugbọn o gbọdọ sọ pe o ko mọ ọ lẹhin ọdun 17, DCMA ti ṣe iṣẹ lile lati ṣe igbesiwaju ati ṣe idaabobo itan ati itan itan Zanzibar nipa orin.

en: The birthplace of legendary taarab singers Siti Binti Saad and Fatuma Binti Baraka, or Bi. Kidude, Zanzibar is home to musical genres that emerged through cultural exchange and collaboration along the Swahili Coast for hundreds of years.
yor: Orírun àwọn olóhùn-iyò akọrin taarab, Siti Binti Saad àti Fatuma Binti Baraka, tí a tún mọ̀ sí Bi. Kidude, Zanzibar ni ilé èyí-ò-jọ̀yìí orin tí ó ti inúu ìbàṣepapọ̀ àṣà àti àjọṣe ọlọ́dún gbọgbọrọ tí ó wà láàárín àwọn àdúgbò ẹ̀ka Swahili.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The birthplace of legendary taarab singers Siti Binti Saad and Fatuma Binti Baraka, or Bi. Kidude, Zanzibar is home to musical genres that emerged through cultural exchange and collaboration along the Swahili Coast for hundreds of years.

en: Today, students can learn traditional musical genres like taarab, ngoma and kidumbak, along with instruments like drums, qanun and oud, as gatekeepers — and interpreters — of culture and tradition.
yor: Láyé òde òní, akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ leè kọ́ orin ìbílẹ̀ bíi taarab, ngoma àti kidumbak, pẹ̀lú àfikún àwọn ohun èlò ìkọrin bíi ìlù ní oníranànran, qanun àti oud, gẹ́gẹ́ bí alápamọ́ — àti òǹgbifọ̀ — àṣà àti ìṣe.
mt0: Ṣugbọn loni, awọn ọmọ ile-iwe le kọ awọn orin orin ibile bii taarab, ngoma ati kidumbak, ati awọn ohun orin bii drums, qanun ati oud, bi awọn ọlọ́pà - ati awọn akọkọ - ti awọn itan ati itan-itan.

en: Neema Surri, a violin player at the DCMA, has been studying the violin since the age of 9.
yor: Neema Surri, a ta violin ní DCMA, ti ń kọ́ bí a ti ṣe ń ta ohun èlòo violin láti ọmọdún mẹ́sàn-án mẹ́nu lé ọ̀rọ̀ nínú àwòrán fídíò DCMA náà.
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ, sọ fun mi pe o ko mọ. Neema Surri, awọn olukọni orin orin orin ni DCMA, ti kọ orin orin orin rẹ lati ọdun mẹrin.

en: "I know many young people who would like to study music but they can’t afford the minimal tuition fee because they are poor and unemployed", Surri said in the DCMA video.
yor: "Mo mọ àwọn ọ̀dọ́mọdé tí ó máa nífẹ̀ẹ́ sí kíkọ́ orin ṣùgbọ́n wọn kò leè san owó ìmẹ̀kọ tí ó jẹ́ owó iléèwé nítorí wípé wọn kúṣẹ̀ẹ́ wọn kò sì ní iṣẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ".

en: After completing DCMA workshops, certificate and diploma courses, many DCMA students go on to perform on world stages as award-winning bands and solo artists.
yor: Ní ìparí àwọn ìdánilẹ́kọ̀ọ́ọ DCMA, tí wọ́n ti gba ìwé ẹ̀rí àti ní òpin ẹ̀kọ́ ọlọ́dún kan, púpọ̀ nínú àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ọ DCMA ni ó ti di àgbà ọ̀jẹ́ tí wọ́n sì í ṣeré lórí ìtàgé kárí ayé.
mt0: Ṣugbọn lẹhin ti o pari awọn iṣẹlẹ DCMA, awọn ẹkọ ati awọn ẹkọ ẹkọ, ọpọlọpọ awọn ọmọ ile-iwe DCMA lọ si ipele agbaye bi awọn orin orin ati awọn aṣere orin.

en: Zanzibar’s Amina Omar Juma, a former DCMA student and current DCMA teacher, recently returned from a tour in South Africa with her critically acclaimed, "Siti and the Band", known for "fusing the roots" by blending traditional taarab sounds with contemporary, layered rhythms.
yor: Ọmọ bíbíi Zanzibar, tí ó jẹ́ akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ọ DCMA nígbà kan rí, tí ó jẹ́ olùkọ́ni ní iléèwé kan náà báyìí, Amina Omar Juma tòun ti ìlú mọ̀ọ́ká ẹgbẹ́ akọrin rẹ̀, tí ó ń "fi àṣà ìró orin ìbílẹ̀ " taarab papọ̀ mọ́ ti ìgbàlódélonígbàńlò kọrin, ìyẹn "Siti àti Ẹgbẹ́ ", ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ padà wọ̀lú láti ìrìnàjò orin kíkọ kan ní orílẹ̀-èdèe South Africa.
mt0: Zanzibar's Amina Omar Juma, a former DCMA student and current DCMA teacher, recently returned from a tour in South Africa with her critically acclaimed, "Siti and the Band", known for "fusing the roots" by blending traditional taarab sounds with contemporary, layered rhythms.

en: She and other band members, also former DCMA students, released their first full album, "Fusing the Roots", in 2018, going on to perform at Sauti za Busara, East Africa's largest music festival, that same year.
yor: Òun, àwọn díẹ̀ nínú ẹgbẹ́ akọrin rẹ̀ àti àpapọ̀ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ DCMA ní ìgbà kan rí ṣe àgbéjáde àwo orin wọn àkọ́kọ́, "Fusing the Roots", ní ọdún-un 2018, tí ó mú wọn oi ng o òǹwòran lára yá ní Sauti za Busara, tí í ṣe àjọ̀dún orin kíkọ tí ó gbàràdá jù lọ ní Ìlà-oòrùn Ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
mt0: Ṣugbọn awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ rẹ, ati awọn ọmọ ile-iwe DCMA, gbe awọn akọkọ orin wọn, "Fusing the Roots", jade ni 2018, o si tẹsiwaju lati ṣere ni Sauti za Busara, awọn ipele orin orin akọkọ ti o tobi ju ni ilẹ Amẹrika.

en: Drawing from a complex history of Indian, Arab and African exchange, the school celebrates the influence of "dhow countries", with inspiration from cultures that converged along the Indian Ocean and the Persian Gulf.
yor: Iléèwé náà ti ṣe àyálò àti àmúpapọ̀ ọ̀kan-ò-jọ̀kan àṣà "àwọn orílẹ̀-èdè dhow", tí ó wà ní ìtòsíi Òkun India àti Ọ̀gbùn-un Persia.
mt0: Drawing from a complex history of Indian, Arab and African exchange, the school celebrates the influence of "dhow countries", with inspiration from cultures that converged along the Indian Ocean and the Persian Gulf.

en: The Omani Sultanate, a "major maritime force from the 17th to 19th centuries", shifted its seat of power from Muscat to Zanzibar in 1840.
yor: Agbègbèe Omani Sultanate, tí ó jẹ́ " ibi gbòógì àwọn alágbára atukọ̀ orí omi ní ọgọ́rùn-ún Ọdún-un kẹtàdínlógún sí kọkàndínlógún sẹ́yìn", gbé àga agbára rẹ̀ láti Muscat sí Zanzibar ní ọdún-un 1840.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The Omani Sultanate, a "major maritime force from the 17th to 19th centuries", shifted its seat of power from Muscat to Zanzibar in 1840.

en: From Stone Town, Omani kings oversaw elaborate systems of maritime trade, including cloves, gold, and textiles, powered by strong winds that set dhows — traditional Arab vessels — sailing across the Indian Ocean, from India to Oman to East Africa.
yor: Láti Stone Town, àwọn ọba Omani ń tukọ̀ọ okòwò orí omi ìgbà náà tí ó fẹjú, títí kan kànáfùrù, wúrà, àti aṣọ , látàrí àwọn ìjì líle tí ń tu àwọn ọkọ̀ ìbílẹ̀ẹ Lárúbáwáa — dhows — ní oríi Òkun Indian, láti India sí Oman títí lọ dé Ìlà-Oòrùn Ilẹ̀ Adúláwọ̀.
mt0: Leave it to me, if you can't translate it, just say you don't know.

en: Young Zanzibaris recognize the importance of connecting with the past to determine their future and the music created today expresses that desire to bridge the old with the new.
yor: Àwọn ọ̀dọ́ ní Zanzibar mọ rírìi ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ àtẹ̀yìnwá tí ó ní ohun ńlá ní í ṣe fún ọjọ́ ọ̀la wọn, ni wọ́n fi ń ṣe àdàlù èyí tí a rí nínú àwọn orin òde òní tí wọn ń gbé jáde.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know. Young Zanzibaris recognize the importance of connecting with the past to determine their future and the music created today expresses that desire to bridge the old with the new.

en: DCMA students and teachers recently formed "TaraJazz", a blend of traditional taarab and modern jazz.

mt0: Ẹnikẹni o mọ ọ, awọn ọmọ ile-iwe ati awọn ọmọ ile-iwe ti DCMA ti ṣe awọn "TaraJazz", a awọn aṣa taarab ati jazz ọjọgbọn.

en: The Swahili coast tells the story of epic cultural exchanges and the DCMA continues this tradition through its musical collaborations.
yor: Agbègbèe Swahili sọ ìtàn pàṣípààrọ àṣà ìbílẹ̀ tí DCMA ṣì ń tẹ̀síwájú nínúu rẹ̀ pẹ̀lú àjọṣepọ̀ àwọn orin-in rẹ̀ .
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The Swahili coast tells the story of epic cultural exchanges and the DCMA continues this tradition through its musical collaborations.

en: Every year, the school hosts an initiative called "Swahili Encounters", matching well-known musicians hailing from Africa, the Middle East, Europe and North America with DCMA students to create original musical compositions within a week-long period.
yor: Lọ́dọọdún, iléèwé náà máa ń gbàlejò fún ètò tí a pè ní "Ìkọlù Swahili", tí ó mú àgbárijọpọ̀ọ àgbà akọrin láti Ilẹ̀-Adúláwọ̀, Ìlú Abẹ́-àkóso Lárúbáwá, Ilẹ̀ Éróòpù àti Àríwá Amẹ́ríkà pẹ̀lú àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ DCMA láti ṣe orin láàárín ọ̀sẹ̀ kan.
mt0: Every year, the school hosts an initiative called "Swahili Encounters", matching well-known musicians from Africa, the Middle East, Europe and North America with DCMA students to create original musical compositions within a week-long period.

en: At the end of the "encounter", the newly-formed collaboration performs at Sauti za Busara, and many of these collaborations turn into life-time friendships that transcend the boundaries of language and culture, proving music is a universal language.
yor: Ní ìgbẹ̀yìngbẹ́yín "ìkọlù" náà, àgbárijọpọ̀ tuntun náà yóò ta bí elégbé ní Sauti za Busara, tí àjọṣepọ̀ wọ̀nyí yóò sì di ìbáṣepọ̀ ọlọ́jọ́ pípẹ́ tí kò mọ ìyàtọ̀ èdè àti àṣà, tí ó fi hàn gbangba wálíà wípé èdè kan náà tí gbogbo ayé gbọ́ ni orin.
mt0: At the end of the "encounter", the newly-formed collaboration performs at Sauti za Busara, and many of these collaborations turn into life-time friendships that transcend boundaries of language and culture, proving music is a universal language.

en: DCMA offers weekly live performances showcasing students’ talents and collaborations with visiting musicians, Stone Town, Zanzibar, 2019. Photo courtesy of DCMA.
yor: DCMA máa ń ṣe àgbékalẹ̀ ètò orin kíkọ tí ó ń ṣe ìgbélárugẹ ẹ̀bùn orin kíkọ àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ àti àfihàn àjọṣepọ̀ pẹ̀lú ọ̀kọrin àlejò hàn ní, Stone Town, Zanzibar, 2019. DCMA ni ó ni àwòrán.
mt0: DCMA offers weekly live performances showcasing students' talents and collaborations with visiting musicians, Stone Town, Zanzibar, 2019. Photo courtesy of DCMA.

en: The DCMA recognizes that music empowers and unites people across cultures — and it also employs talented youth living in a struggling economy with limited job opportunities.
yor: DCMA mọ rírì orin gẹ́gẹ́ bí ohun tí ó leè ró àwọn ènìyàn lágbára àti gẹ́gẹ́ bí ohun tí ó lè mú ìṣọ̀kan àti ìrẹ́pọ̀ bá àwọn ènìyàn láì wo ti àṣà — ó sì tún ń pèsè àǹfààní iṣẹ́ fún àwọn ọ̀dọ́ tí ó ní ẹ̀bùn àmọ́ tí ó ń tiraka láti jẹ.
mt0: Ẹnikẹni mọ pe orin ṣe iranlọwọ ati ṣe ibatan awọn eniyan lori awọn ede - ati pe o ṣe iṣẹ fun awọn ọmọde ọdọ ti o n gbe ni a struggling economy ti o ni awọn iṣẹ ipese iyemeji.

en: For the 1,800 students who have trained at the DCMA, this is the only musical home they know, where they can learn and grow as professional musicians and artists.
yor: Fún àwọn akẹ́kọ̀ọ́ 1,800 tí ó ti gba ìdánilẹ́kọọ́ ní DCMA, èyí nìkan ni ibi ilé orin tí wọ́n mọ̀, níbi tí wọ́n ti ń kọ́ ẹ̀kọ́ tí wọ́n sì ti ń ní àlékún ìmọ̀ nípa iṣẹ́ orin kíkọ àti bí a ṣe ń di òǹkọrin.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know For the 1,800 students who have trained at the DCMA, this is the only musical home they know, where they can learn and grow as professional musicians and artists.

en: One traveler from Spain, who recently visited the DCMA, wrote on TripAdvisor: "Personally, meeting the musicians was the best piece of my time on this island".

en: As Zanzibar’s tourism sector rapidly grows, the DCMA believes that music plays an essential role in the celebration, preservation and promotion of Swahili culture, heritage and history.

en: A village near Jamshedpur in Jharkhand. Picture courtesy Anumeha Verma
yor: Ìletò kan ní ẹ̀báa Jamshedpur ní Jharkhand. Àwòrán láti ọwọ́ọ Anumeha Verma
mt0: A village near Jamshedpur in Jharkhand. Image courtesy of Anumeha Verma

en: On 20 July, four elderly people were lynched by a mob in the Gumla District of Jharkhand, India after being accused of practicing witchcraft.
yor: Ní ọjọ́ 20 oṣù Agẹmọ, àgbájọ àwọn ènìyànkéènìà gba ẹ̀mí àwọn àgbàlagbà mẹ́rin kan láì dá wọn lẹ́jọ́ ní agbègbèe Gumla ní Jharkhand, India lẹ́yìn tí a fi ẹ̀sùn-un àjẹ́ kàn wọ́n.

en: According to reports, the victims were accused of causing a man's death and they were eventually found guilty of witchcraft by a Panchayat (a village assembly).
yor: Gẹ̀gẹ̀ bí ìjábọ̀ ìròyìn, àwọn àgbàlagbà wọ̀nyí ṣe ikú pa ọkùnrin kan, ni ìgbìmọ̀ abúlée Panchayat ṣe dá wọn lẹ́bi.
mt0: According to reports, the victims were accused of causing a man's death and they were eventually found guilty of witchcraft by a Panchayat (a village assembly).

en: The victims were dragged out of their homes and beaten to death by masked men wielding sticks.
yor: Wọ́n wọ́ àwọn àgbàlagbà mẹ́rin wọ̀nyí jáde síta ilée wọn, àwọn ọkùnrin tí ó bòjú sì fi igi lù wọ́n títí tí ẹ̀mí fi bọ́ lára wọn.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan. Ti o ba ko le ṣe alaye nikan sọ pe o ko mọ. Awọn ẹlẹṣẹ ni a gbe jade lati ile wọn ati awọn ọkunrin aṣọ wọle awọn ọwọ wọn.

en: Eight of the attackers were subsequently arrested by police.
yor: Mẹ́jọ nínú àwọn ènìyànkéènìà wọ̀nyí ti wà ní akóló ọlọ́pàá.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan. Eight of the attackers were subsequently arrested by police.

en: According to police data published by The Times of India, witch-hunting in Jharkhand has claimed 123 lives from May 2016 to May 2019.
yor: Gẹ̀gẹ̀ bí àkọsílẹ̀ ọlọ́pàá tí Times of India tẹ̀jáde, ìṣọdẹ-àjẹ́ ní Jharkhand ti rán àwọn ènìyàn 123 sọ́run àpàpàǹdodo ní àárín-in oṣù Èbìbí ọdún-un 2016 sí oṣù Èbìbí ọdún-un 2019.
mt0: According to police data published by The Times of India, witch-hunting in Jharkhand has claimed 123 lives from May 2016 to May 2019.

en: Across the country, 134 people were killed for the alleged use of "black magic" in 2016, according to the National Crime Records Bureau.
yor: Jákèjádò, ènìyàn 134 di ẹni ẹbọra-ń-bá-jẹun látàrí èsùn-un lílo “ògùngùn” ní ọdún-un 2016, ìyẹn gẹ̀gẹ̀ bí Àjọ Aṣàkọsílẹ̀ Ẹ̀ṣẹ̀ Orílẹ̀-èdè náà ṣe kọ́ ọ sílẹ̀.
mt0: Awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ́rún mẹ́rin ní ilẹ̀ ní ọdún 2016 ní ìgbà tí wọ́n sọ pé wọ́n mọ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀ ìṣẹ́lẹ̀

en: "Witch-hunting is not new in Jharkhand", says Prem Chand, the Founding Chairman of the Free Legal Aid Committee (FLAC) in Jharkhand, in a telephonic interview.
yor: "Ìṣọdẹ-àjẹ́ kò jẹ́ tuntun ní Jharkhand", Prem Chand, Olúdásílẹ̀ àti Alága Free Legal Aid Committee (FLAC) ní Jharkhand, sọ nínúu ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò orí ẹ̀ro-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ kan.
mt0: "Witch-hunting is not new in Jharkhand," says Prem Chand, the Founder Chairman of the Free Legal Aid Committee (FLAC) in Jharkhand, in a telephonic interview.

en: FLAC has been instrumental in bringing about legislation against witch-hunting in Jharkhand.
yor: FLAC ti ń ṣe àtọ́nàa ìṣòfin tí ó tako ìṣọdẹ-àjẹ́ ní Jharkhand.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know FLAC has been instrumental in bringing about legislation against witch-hunting in Jharkhand.

en: The organisation first began working in this area in 1991 when a woman was accused by her neighbour of causing a boy’s death.
yor: Iléeṣẹ́ náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní agbègbè yìí ní ọdún-un 1991 nígbà tí àwọn aládùúgbò fi ẹ̀sùn kan obìnrin kan pé ó lọ́wọ́ nínú ikú ọmọdékùnrin kan.
mt0: Ẹgbẹ naa bẹrẹ si ṣiṣẹ ni agbegbe yii ni 1991 nigbati ọkunrin kan ti a fi ẹsun fun u pe o pa ọmọ rẹ.

en: An irate mob attacked her and killed her husband and son.

en: When Prem Chand and his colleagues visited the offenders in the prison, they were met with defiance:
yor: Nígbàtí Prem Chand àti àwọn ẹlẹgbẹ́ẹ rẹ̀ ṣe ìbẹ̀wò sí àwọn ẹlẹ́ṣẹ̀ wọ̀nyí nínúu túbú, wọ́n bá ìpèníjà:
mt0: When Prem Chand and his colleagues visited the offenders in the prison, they were met with defiance:

en: They told us that they stood by their accusation.
yor: Wọ́n sọ fún wọn wípé àwọn dúró lé oríi ẹ̀sùn tí wọ́n fi kan àwọn.
mt0: Ẹnikẹni sọ fun wa pe wọn ṣe idajọ wọn.

en: They also shared a belief that when the blood of a woman branded as a witch falls on the ground, she loses her so-called powers of sorcery.
yor: Wọ́n sì tún gbàgbọ́ wípé bí ẹ̀jẹ̀ẹ ẹni tí a pè ní àjẹ́ bá kan ilẹ̀ ọ̀gẹ́rẹ́, yóò pàdánù agbára ẹlẹyẹ rẹ̀.
mt0: They also shared a belief that when the blood of a woman branded as a witch falls on the ground, she loses her so-called powers of sorcery.

en: Prem Chand says that it affects specific sectors of the population:

en: Usually, it is the women from the weaker sections of the society and economically backward regions that are targeted.
yor: Nígbàgbogbo, àwọn obìnrin tí kò lárá tí ó tálákà ní í máa ń fi ara kááṣá.

en: The victims are mostly Adivasis, Harijans and Dalits.
yor: Àwọn tí ó f’ara kááṣá wọ̀nyí ni àwọn Adivasis, Harijans àti Dalits.
mt0: Ẹnikẹni nikan sọ ọ mọ awọn ẹlẹṣẹ wọn. Awọn ẹlẹṣẹ wọn jẹ awọn Adivasi, Harijans ati Dalits.

en: It is an assault on the dignity of women and a violation of constitutional rights for a dignified life for every human being.
yor: Ìfojú iyì àwọn obìnrin àti ìtasẹ̀ àgẹ̀rẹ̀ sí òfin ẹ̀tọ́ sí ayé iyì fún gbogbo ọmọ ènìyàn.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe awọn aṣoju lori ẹtọ awọn ọmọbirin ati awọn ẹtọ constitutional fun igbesi aye ẹtọ fun gbogbo eniyan.

en: The Social and Political Realities
yor: Òtítọ́ Àwùjọ àti Ìṣèlú
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan awọn alaye ti o mọ nikan. Ti o ko ba le ṣe alaye awọn alaye ti o mọ nikan sọ pe o ko mọ awọn alaye ti o mọ.

en: Activists say that deeply rooted superstitions prevalent in the hinterlands are a major cause behind the practice.
yor: Àwọn ajìjàngbara sọ wípé ìgbàgbọ́-asán tí ó rinlẹ̀ ní ìgbèríko ni ó ń fa ìwà pálapalà náà.
mt0: Ṣugbọn awọn activists sọ pe awọn superstitions ti o gbooro lọ si awọn ilẹ abẹ́ jẹ́ ohun ihò nla nínú ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ náà.

en: A lack of education, poor health facilities and economic backwardness mark the regions where these practices are prevalent.
yor: Àìgbẹ̀kọ́, ètò ìlera tí ò pójú òṣùwọ̀n àti kòlàkòṣagbe tí ó ń gb’àgbègbè tí ìwà pálapalà wọ̀nyí ti gbalẹ̀ bí i ìtàkùn ni ó fi wọ́pọ̀.
mt0: A lack of education, poor health facilities and economic backwardness mark the regions where these practices are prevalent.

en: The cases so far show that often a rumor started by someone is enough to get the ball rolling.
yor: Ọ̀ràn wọ̀nyí ti fi hàn wípé àhesọ ni ó máa fi ń bẹ̀rẹ̀ .
mt0: Ṣugbọn awọn ẹlẹṣẹ lọwọlọwọ ṣe afihan pe o ṣee ṣe ki o bẹrẹ rumor nipa ẹnikan.

en: Despite the laws enacted by various Indian states which declare witch-hunting to be illegal, participants in these cases see it as a form of self-defense.
yor: Pẹ̀lú òfin àwọn ìpínlẹ̀ India tí ó ka ìṣọdẹ-àjẹ́ sí ohun tí ó lòdì sófin, àwọn akópa ọ̀ràn wọ̀nyí rí i gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀nà ìdáààbò-ara-ẹni.
mt0: Ṣugbọn awọn ẹya ara ẹrọ ti a ṣe ni awọn orilẹ-ede India ti o sọ wipe awọn ẹranko witch hunting jẹ ẹtọ, awọn ọmọ ẹgbẹ ninu awọn ẹgbẹ wọnyi rii i gẹgẹbi ọna idaabobo ara wọn.

en: It is also used as an excuse for grabbing resources owned by women, exacting revenge or even exploiting women for sex.
yor: Bákan náà ni wọ́n ń wí àwáwí fún gbígba ohun ìní àwọn obìnrin, fi agbára gbẹ̀san tàbí fi ipá bá obìnrin lò pọ̀.

en: Witch-hunting across India

mt0: Witch-hunting across India

en: Jharkhand has recorded the highest number of crimes committed in the name of witch-hunting but it is not the only state.
yor: Jharkhand ti ṣe àkọsílẹ̀ iye ẹṣẹ̀ àwọn ènìyán ṣẹ̀ tí ó pọ̀ jù lọ tí ó tan mọ́ ìṣọdẹ-àjẹ́ àmọ́ kì í ṣe ìpínlẹ̀ náà nìkan.
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ, Jharkhand ti ṣe itanran awọn ẹṣẹ nla ninu awọn orukọ witch-hunting, ṣugbọn ko nikan ni o.

en: Cases of witch-hunting have been reported from Chattisgarh, Odisha, Gujarat, West Bengal Assam, Bihar, Maharashtra and Rajasthan too.
yor: Ọ̀ràn-an ìṣọdẹ-àjẹ́ ti wà l’ákọsílẹ̀ ní Chattisgarh, Odisha, Gujarat, West Bengal Assam, Bihar, Maharashtra àti Rajasthan pẹ̀lú.

en: In a chilling incident in 2014, Debjani Bora, an Indian athlete had become a target in Assam.
yor: Nígbà ìṣẹ̀lẹ̀ kan ní 2014, Debjani Bora, ẹlẹ́sẹ̀ ehoro ọmọ bíbíi orílẹ̀-èdèe India ti fi ara kááṣá rí.
mt0: In a chilling incident in 2014, Debjani Bora, an Indian athlete had become a target in Assam.

en: According to Debjani’s statements, she was accused of being the cause of several deaths in Cherekali village located 180 km from Guwahati, the capital of the eastern state in India.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ọ̀rọ̀ọ Debjani, a f’ẹ̀sùn-un ìgbẹ̀mí ènìyàn púpọ̀ kàn án ní abúlée Cherekali tí ó wà ní kìlómità 180 láti Guwahati, olú-ìlúu India ti apáa ìlà-oòrùn.
mt0: Debjani's statements indicate that she was accused of being the cause of several deaths in Cherekali village, located 180 km from Guwahati, the capital of the eastern state in India.

en: She was allegedly named by a headman of a village prayer hall and brutally assaulted by the villagers.
yor: Olóríi gbọ̀gán àdúrà abúlé l’ó dárúkọ rẹ̀ tí àwọn ará abúlé sí fi ìyà jẹ́ ẹ.
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ o, sọ o mọ nikan.

en: 2017 witnessed several cases in the state of Rajasthan.

en: Among these, a 40-year-old woman Kanya Devi was attacked and beaten to death after being accused by her family members in Ajmer district of the state.

en: People blame accused witches for causing a slew of misfortunes: the death of a person or animal, droughts, crop failures, etc.
yor: Àwọn ènìyàn ń f’ẹ̀sùn kan àwọn ẹlẹyẹ fún iṣẹ́-ibi ọwọ́ọ wọn: ikú ènìyàn tàbí ẹranko, ọ̀dá òjò, àìso jìngbìnnì irúgbìn, àti bẹ́èbẹ́è lọ.

en: The attacks on these women (and some men) are vicious and inhuman.
yor: Ìkọlù tí ó kọ lu àwọn obìnrin wọ̀nyí (àti àwọn ọkùnrin kan) rorò bí ẹranko ẹhànnà.

en: At times, the accusations and punishment are meted out by their families.
yor: Nígbà mìíràn, àwọn èsùn náà àti ìjìyà ẹṣé máa wá láti ọ̀dọ̀ mọ̀lébíi wọn.

en: Some have lived to tell the tale and fight. Chutni Mahato of Saraikela in Jharkhand is one of them.
yor: Àwọn kan ń gbé tí wọ́n sì ń sọ ìtàn-an wọn tí wọ́n sì ń jà fún ẹ̀tọ́ọ wọn.

en: People from the region call her a "tigress".
yor: Chutni Mahato ti Saraikela ní Jharkhand jẹ́ ọ̀kan lára wọn.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan o sọ wipe o ko mọ. Awọn eniyan ni agbegbe naa pe ọ jẹ "tigress".

en: She was accused of practicing witchcraft in 1995.
yor: Àwọn ènìyàn láti agbègbè náà máa ń pè é ní "tigress".
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe awọn aṣoju nikan. Ti o ba ko le ṣe aṣoju nikan sọ pe o ko mọ.

en: Since then, she has transformed into an activist crusading against the victimization of women in the name of witch-hunting with the help of NGOs working to end the practice.
yor: Wọ́n fi ẹ̀sùn-un àjẹ́ kàn-án ní ọdún-un 1995. Láti ìgbà náà, ó ti yírapadà di ajìjàǹgbara olùtako ìfìyàjẹ àwọn obìnrin pẹ̀lú àtìléyìn Ilé-iṣẹ́-tí-kìí-ṣe-tìjọba.
mt0: Since then, she has become an activist fighting against the victimization of women in the name of witch-hunting with the help of NGOs working to end the practice.

en: Chutni expresses how the lack of resources often makes it a struggle to fight against the practice.
yor: Chutni sọ bí àìsí àtìlẹ́yìn tó késejárí ṣe mú u nira láti jà tako ìwà pálapàla yìí.

en: I wish there was more support from the authorities and government for the work that we are doing here.
yor: Ìbájẹ́pé àtìlẹ́yìn tó tó wá láti ọwọ́ àwọn oníṣẹọba àti ìjọba fún iṣẹ́ tí à ń ṣe níbí.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le sọ ohunkohun nikan. Mo fẹ ki awọn ọlọpa ati awọn ijọba ṣe iranlọwọ fun iṣẹ ti a n ṣe nibi.

en: However, I have suffered because of this practice.
yor: Síbẹ̀síbẹ̀, mo ti jìyà nítorí ìwà pálapàla yìí.
mt0: Ṣugbọn, nitori ilana yii, Mo ti jiya.

en: When someone comes to me for help, I am always going to stand by them, she said in a telephonic interview.
yor: Bí ènìyàn bá tọ̀ mí wá fún ìrànlọ́wọ́, mo máa dúró tì wọ́n gbágbágbá, ó sọ nínúu ìfọ̀rọ̀wánilẹ́nuwò orí ẹ̀ro-ìbánisọ̀rọ̀ kan.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan. Ṣugbọn nigba ti ẹnikan ba beere mi fun iranlọwọ, Mo n duro duro fun wọn, o sọ ninu iwiregbe tẹlifonu.

en: When forestry staff found her deep in the jungle of the Irrawaddy Delta, Ayeyar Sein was three months old.

mt0: When forestry staff found her deep in the jungle of the Irrawaddy Delta, Ayeyar Sein was three months old.

en: One of her legs was caught in a steel trap laid by poachers.

en: Now she is one of eight calves being sheltered at Wingabaw, Myanmar’s only elephant orphanage.

en: Another calf, Ayeyar Maung, endured a similar ordeal.

en: Before his arrival at the camp, the six-month-old was snared in a wire trap.

en: As he was stuck among a group of boulders in the same forest where Ayeyar Sein was found, his herd was forced to leave him behind.

en: Tobago's coral reefs are an integral part of both the island's marine ecosystem and its economy.
yor: Iyùn-un abẹ́ òkúta òkun jẹ́ ohun tí a ò leè fọwọ́ rọ́ sẹ́yìn nínú àwọn àmúṣọrọ̀ tí ó ń mú ọrọ̀ Ajé Tobago àti àwọn àyíká erékùṣù náà gbòòrò.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye nikan, sọ pé o ko mọ. Ẹnikẹni kò mọ ohun ti awọn coral reefs ṣe ninu awọn ẹya ara ẹrọ ọkọ̀ oju omi ati awọn ọja rẹ.

en: Home to numerous species of marine life (and a main source of fish for local fishermen), they also protect the coastline from wave erosion and the effects of tropical storms.
yor: Ibùgbé ọ̀kan-òjọ̀kan ẹ̀yà ẹ̀dá inú omi (àti ibi ẹja pípa fún àwọn apẹja ìbílẹ̀), tí ó sì tún ń dá ààbò bo èbúté, èyí tí kò mú kí àwọn ìjì líle etí omi ó pọ̀ kọjá àlà ni à ń sọ.
mt0: Home to numerous species of marine life (and a main source of fish for local fishermen), they also protect the coastline from wave erosion and the effects of tropical storms.

en: Popular spots like Buccoo Reef are also popular tourist attractions.
yor: Òkúta inú òkun Buccoo Reef tí o gbajúmọ̀ bí ìṣáná ẹlẹ́ta tí àwọn arìnrìn-àjò afẹ́ máa ń wọ́ tùùrùtù níbẹ̀ náà kò gbẹ́yìn.
mt0: Ṣe o ko le ṣe alaye awọn aaye olokiki bii Buccoo Reef, o jẹ awọn aaye olokiki fun awọn ọmọ ilu.

en: But after a press release issued by the country's Institute of Marine Affairs (IMA) on August 22, 2019, in which it warned that — based on findings from the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration's (NOAA) Coral Reef Watch — Tobago's coral reefs have been placed on a watch for "Bleaching Alert Level One", all eyes are on the island.
yor: Àmọ́ lẹ́yìn àtẹ̀jáde kan sí ilé ìròyìn tí Àjọ tí ó ń ṣàkóso Omi orílẹ̀ èdè náà (IMA) tẹ̀ jáde ní ọjọ́ 22, oṣù Ògún ọdún-un 2019, èyí tí ó kìlọ̀ wípé – ìwádìíi National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) Coral Reef Watch sọ wípé — iyùn abẹ́ òkúta òkun Tobago ti bọ́ sì abẹ́ ìṣọ́ láti ṣe òfíntótó "Ìkéde Ìpàwọ̀dàa Ìpele Ìkíni", gbogbo ojú ló ń wo erékùṣù náà.

en: There is a distinct possibility that the bleaching could advance to Level Two within a matter of weeks, which would threatens not only the existence of the reefs themselves, but also the island's marine life and people.
yor: A ì í ṣe é mọ̀, ìpàwọ̀dà náà lè fò fẹ̀rẹ̀ sí ìpele kejì láàárín ọ̀sẹ̀ díẹ̀, tí yóò sì fa àkóbá fún ìwàláàyè àwọn iyùn wọ̀nyí, àwọn ẹ̀dá inú omi mìíràn àti àwọn olùgbé erékùṣù náà.
mt0: Ẹnikẹni lè sọ pé a lè ṣe ìgbàgbọ́ ní ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́rin, èyí tí ó lè jẹ́ ìjàmbá ní àwọn ẹ̀yà àti àwọn ènìyàn ní ìlú.

en: What exactly is bleaching?
yor: Kí ni ohun tí ń pàwọ̀dà ní pàtó?

en: Corals coexist with and become home to symbiotic algae, helping it store nutrients and remove waste.
yor: Alábàágbé àti alájọṣe iyùn ni àwọn ewé inú omi tí ó máa ń bá a kó ohun aṣaralóore pamọ́ àti da èérí ara nù.
mt0: Corals coexist with and become home to symbiotic algae, helping it store nutrients and remove waste.

en: In return, the algae gives the coral the energy it needs to grow, but drastic changes in water temperature can threaten this cooperative relationship.
yor: Ewé wọ̀nyí yóò sì fún iyùn ní okun tí ó nílò fún ìdàgbàsókè, àmọ́ àyípadà ìgbóná inú omi ń dí àjọṣepọ̀ yìí lọ́wọ́.

en: When water becomes too hot (or too cold) the corals expel the algae — and with it, its main source of food.
yor: Bí omi bá gbóná ju bí ó ṣe yẹ lọ (tàbí bí ó bá tutù jù) àwọn iyùn yóò lé ewé omi — tí yóò sì pàdánù ọwọ́ tí ó ń fi oúnjẹ nù ún.
mt0: When water becomes too hot (or too cold) the corals expel the algae — and with it, its main source of food.

en: Eventually, the coral starves to death; the most noticeable outward sign of this phenomenon is that the coral loses its colour, going from shades of brown and green to a crisp, brittle, bone white.
yor: Àṣèyìnwá àṣẹ̀yìnbọ̀, ebi yóò pa iyùn kú; àwọ̀ ara tí yóò yí padà ni àmì tí a ó fi mọ̀, ìpàwọ̀dà láti àwọ̀ olómi-ọkà àti ewéko sí funfun egungun.

en: Bleaching Level Alert One means that the corals are extremely likely to start the bleaching process.
yor: Ìkéde Ìpàwọ̀dà Ìpele Kìíní ń kéde wípé bí a kò bá wá nǹkan ṣe sí i, àwọn iyùn náà yóò bẹ̀rẹ̀ sí í pàwọ̀dà.
mt0: Bleaching Level Alert One means that the corals are extremely likely to start the bleaching process.

en: The IMA therefore suggests that both biologists and citizens should keep an eye out for signs of bleaching over the next 9-12 weeks.
yor: IMA dábàá wípé kí àwọn onímọ̀ ìṣẹ̀dá àti ọmọ ìlú ó máa ṣọ́ àwọn ẹ̀dá inú omi náà fún àwọn àmì ìpàwọ̀dà ní àárín-in ọ̀sẹ̀ mẹ́sàn-án sí méjìlá tí ó ń bọ̀.
mt0: IMA therefore suggests that both biologists and citizens should keep an eye out for signs of bleaching over the next 9-12 weeks.

en: Level Two bleaching would be an indication of widespread coral bleaching and coral mortality.

en: What causes it?
yor: Kí ló fa sábàbí?
mt0: Ṣe o ko mọ ohun ti o ṣẹlẹ?

en: According to local coral reef ecologist Anjani Ganase, the main contributors to coral bleaching in Tobago are the warmer water temperatures — a result of climate change.
yor: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí onímọ̀ àyíká ìbílẹ̀ Anjani Ganase ti ṣe ṣàlàyé, ọ̀dádá tí ó dá ìpàwọ̀dà iyùn-un Tobago ni ìwọ̀n ìgbóná omi tí ó re òkè — tí í ṣe arapa àyípadà ojú-ọjọ́.
mt0: According to local coral reef ecologist Anjani Ganase, the main contributors to coral bleaching in Tobago are the warmer water temperatures - a result of climate change.

en: Via email, Ganase explained that the ocean absorbs much of the heat in the atmosphere, which in turn causes the water — especially shallower bodies of water, like the Caribbean Sea — to heat up.
yor: Nínú ímeèlì, Ganase ṣàlàyé wípé òkun máa ń fa èyí tí ó pọ̀ nínú ooru inú afẹ́fẹ́ mu, tí ó sì ń fa kí omi — pàápàá jù lọ àwọn ibú omi jínjìn gbungbunrungbun bíi Ọ̀sàa Caribbean — ó gbóná janjan.
mt0: Via email, Ganase explained that the ocean absorbs much of the heat in the atmosphere, which in turn causes the water — especially lower bodies of water, like the Caribbean Sea — to heat up.

en: In fact, NOAA's 12-week outlook extends well past Tobago to the reefs of the Lesser Antilles.
yor: Kódà, ìṣọ́ ọlọ́sẹ̀ méjìláa NOAA Tobago tan pinpin àyípadà yìí dé iyùn Lesser Antilles.

en: Other reefs around the region, most notably in parts of the Greater Antilles and Cuba, have already been placed on a Level Two Bleaching Alert:
